item.title: CSS for JS Notes (1)
item.description: Course: CSS for JS Module 0 - Fundamentals Media Queries /* CSS */ @media (condition) { /* Some CSS that'll run if the condition is met. */ } Hiding content It’s common to use media queries to have alternative interfaces depending on the screen size. display: none is a declaration that removes an element from the rendering process; it’s as if it doesn’t exist. By default, we’ll hide any elements with the large-screens class.
